chapter.title: Before You Install OpenICF Software
chapter.para: This chapter covers prerequisites for installing and running OpenICF software. If you have a special request to support a component or combination not listed here, contact ForgeRock at info@forgerock.com.

section.title: Java Requirements
section.para: OpenICF requires Java Development Kit 1.6. ForgeRock has tested this release primarily with Oracle Java SE JDK.

section.title: Connector Server Requirements
section.para: If you choose to run an OpenICF connector server, then read this section.

section.title: .NET Connector Servers

listitem.para: .NET Framework 3.5 or later (but not 4.0 or later)

section.para: Specific .NET connector bundles might come with additional requirements.

section.title: Java Connector Servers
section.para: Java Connector Servers require Java 1.5 or later.
Specific Java connector bundles might come with additional requirements.

section.title: Supported Connectors to Data Resources
section.para: This section covers the basic data resources that OpenICF connectors support.

Many advanced connectors not listed in this section are also available, including connectors for IBM Resource Access Control Facility (RACF), IBM Tivoli Access Manager (TAM), SAP, a wide range of databases, as well as enterprise and cloud applications. If you require support for a data resource connector not mentioned here, contact ForgeRock at info@forgerock.com.

itemizedlist.para: ForgeRock has tested connectors with the following data resources.

listitem.para: Microsoft Active Directory (tested with the .NET connector server on Windows 2008)
